Posts.Content: May 10, 2009 02:49PM candy14510 wrote: Hey All, it's candy14510....back from my bilat max with diep......got home yesterday and feel really great today, compared to thursday and Friday...I want to point out to all that I had the DIEP....they took tummy fat and reconnstructed both my breast.  It was a 10 hour surgry...so for obveious reasons, my recovery time will differ wtih most of you.  But for those having DIEP, I do want to be honest.  I went in Tues am @ 6am....was affraid of the nuclear jection (radioactive tracer)(Was clear by the way)....but that was a breeze...they gave me a cream, inwhich i requested, per this site.  They did tell me they don't use it very often, but the nurse said it shoudl be standard procedure to use it.  SO ASK!! (elma? something like that). So the next thing i remember is in the recovery room 8pm that night....crazy how you have no idea of time...that was nice!!  I did will Wed am....then becasue i was under so long, I developed seriouse gas problems...the pain made me nausas...having my belly cut from one hip to the other...throwing up...not good!! My caregivers were awsome!!! So helpful too!!!  Saturday I woke up @ 3 am.....and started texting everyone, that it was amazing but I felt great and was ready to go home!!!  I was amazed at how that hump ended and started so quickly. If it were just my breast, I would say, it would have have been the experience that I had....I think most of you are NOT having DIEP....so you really have nothing to worry about!!  My husband has been awesome....says I look great, even though I feel like Frankinstien!!  I've been up today since 6:30 am went to lay down for an hour once and besides feeling tight in the chest and tummy, I really feel good!!!!!  I did get my pathology report, haven't digested it yet...my one lymp node, was initially was "clear"....but  they ran more test and found Micro...things....my surgeon said its was 4.1 cm...larger then thought, but all margins were "Clean"....I will meet the oncologist in a couple weeks....I wanted to take one thing at a time....healing now....then figure chemo into the factor.  Sorry standing and typing...so I'm going to go for now.......sorry for typo's!!!!  Good luck to you all!!  I just want to say "I'm GLAD IT's OUT!!!"

Posts.Content: May 27, 2009 11:16AM candy14510 wrote: Hi Ladies....it's been a couple weeks, just checking in, as a take a break from this nightmarish roller coaster!!!!  3 weeks and a Day since my bi-lat mx w/Diep.....I still have my abdomen drain it....I hate it....I'm sooooo tired of it!!!  Draining a good 100cc....needs to be down to 30-25!!! Mostly feeling tightness and mild discomfort....glad I did recon @ time of mx.  They removed my sentinel node....was originally negative....however with this great technology, with later testing, found a microcasim 0.06 cm!!!  A few years ago, It would be negative....but not today, however, they feel confident others would be negative....this was the original node, that looked suspicious in my ultrasound...all others looked normal.  Found out I am ER-/PR- and HER2+.....Crap!!!! I have 6 cycles of Carboplatin, Taxotere and Herceptin....Herceptin however, I am lucky enough to continue on for a whole YEAR!!!!  Wow, my odds have not been good,throughout....I'm hoping I will be the 20% who DON'T loose their HAIR!!! Starting Chemo June 12th....hoping I don't feel miserable.....and I can work through it!!!! Lorena, you and I have alot in common ER-/PR-/HER2+....and I had the DIEP.....please ask any questions...I'd like to know what chemo drugs you are taking and for how long.  Ladies, as always thank you sooooo much for being here....it helps to not feel so alone....so many of my friends, don't get it.....I had a couple bad, feeling sorry for myself days....My son just graduated last night.....I cried uncontrollably....He's also leaving for the Air Force July 21st....so that is sad for me....especially being sick....I just want him around!!!!  Anyway, today my "Pity Party" is over and I'm my usual, positive self......feels much better then feeling sorry for myself....I hate that feeling!!!!  Again, thank you so much for everything!!!! One step at a time...next chemo!!!! Good luck to you all!!!  God Bless!!!

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2009 02:29PM candy14510 wrote: Hey All, The Look Good Feel Good was at my Cancer Center.  It's a national program....$300 worth of FREE stuff...again it was nice to be around other cancer patients...everyone there had started already, I hadn't.....but everyone go teary-eyed when they played the video....the part about hair loss!!!!  Why is that so hard???  Even after loosing it????  Well today I met with the U of Minnesota......Loved Dr. E....she was soooo much better then my other onocolgist......and actually recommend I do the AC, followed by Taxol, then radiation...followed by herceptin for a year!!!!!  That is completely different from what my other OC said!!!!  I want the best, to give me good odds of NO RETURN.....I'm happy....but now I KNOW I WILL LOOSE MY HAIR!!!!!  I made the decision today, to have my LONG hair....which is beautiful, by the way.....CUT next wed!!!  I think it wont be so dramatic...alll this long hair coming out.....god I HATE this!!!!!!!  I know I need to get over it!!!!  The lady who is giving me a FREE wig Tuesday @ the Hospital, said last year only 3-4 woman she saw lost eyebrow and lashes......does anyone know about that????  It just wouldn't seem so bad, if at least I had those!!!! Rinna, Happy birthday to you too!!!  My son's graduation party is June 27th too...the good thing is I'll be 2 weeks after a cycle.....so it shouldn't be so bad!!!!! So glad you are all here with me.....not that we want to be here....but you know what I mean!!!! Polly

Diane/Becky: I am taking 12 weeks of taxol with herceptin every week!!!  I ask OC today and she said she perefers to give Herceptin weekly...but i could take it colser to home (45 miles away), but still see here every week.  Then she told me that she would recomment rad's...i'm like ok...so 5-6 weeks?? Yep...i'm like ok......once a week??  NO....EVERYDAY!!!!  gotta do what a girls gotta do....i will take that in my home town for convience sake!!! Diane, More Power to you and wearing wig to work.....I cried when people tried to completment me....I told then not to say anything!!  I'm sure your head does NOT look like an egg!!! So you are completey shaved..or a buzz???  It's hard, but I aleviated a problem....I'll explain in a moment!!! Bettina: I cant beilive Susie could keep a wig on all nite...and a dumb girl touches it and it practically comes off!!!! Crazy!!! I told you all about my boss at work...well it got better on my first offical day i the office for a meeting with everyone.....he quit!!!! We all started this office together....2 other great co-workers quit that day as well...and our previous head guy quite a couple months ago....there is something going on....So some advised to go on medical leave...i'm close to my LTD because I was out for 2 month already....The stress of everything...work, cancer...Hair...my blood pressure has always been low....last 2 treatments 155/105, 144/98....I a taking Blood Pressure meds now as well and monitoring my readings a couple times a day.  Without the worries of work....I can consentrate on me....not my sales ranking and wether I'm not going to have a job!!!  My HR person...told me after FLMA if I do not come back....I will have "Voluntarily" left the company and I will have to "Re-Appy".....I broke down....that sound too crazy!!! Called an attorney and she said it is correct for FLMA...HOWEVER....I am know protected by the "Disablities Act"....so they are a large enough company, that they should beable to make resonable accomidations for me.  However, they may still take my salary away when I do come back and I would have to file for unemployment......That's why my blood pressure is HIGH!!! (I hope) Anyway my LTD is pretty good....so NO work for this over acheiver through Mid January.....wow!!! Patti: thanks for the website!!! Susie:Funny story!!! Gjlanders: So happy you can go to Rome!!! Enjoy!!! Lynn: Did you Shave or buzz your hair???  Mine is buzzed but has been coming out a lot!!! Lots of bald spots developing....what did you use if you shaved it ALL OFF???? I really want to do it...my scalp doesn't hurt anymore...just short hairs are annoying everywhere! Diane48 and Pam, welcome and good luck with your first treatments....don't overwhelm your self with possiable side effect....just let them come as they come....(well except the hair...I had a hard time with that, as you may have read!!)  I hardley had any SE worth mentioning....the OC remainded me that it should be identical to the first...except I will probley be more tired as i hit 2, 3, 4 of AC....thoughts and prayers!!!! Tom: Daine is strong...as other mentioned, it gives her the control over this....I was adiment about buzzing it.....people were like, why....I later was on line to a website for hair loss...they said the exact same thing....good for her...and good for you for being such a good support for her!!!  My husband  does ok too......however he did have a wierd delayed reaction to me not working for 8 more month!!! I do get 60% of my earnings through LTD....so that shoudl still work...I know its the money thing for him....but he's over it now!!!  He tell's me how beautiful I am with no hair...I'm like right!!!  But he's very sincere!!! Good-Luck!! Caroyln: Saved you for last!!!  I has cancer in one breast and made the decsision to have both removed....While it is completely an INDIVIDUAL personal experiece, I want to share with you why I had both removed.  My grandmother had breast cancer in one, this was the 70's(long ago before great meds)...was treated and some years later got it again in her other breast and passed away, becasue she went untreated...hated chemo!!!  That tells me in my fam history, that there is a strong possiablilty for me.  My beleif is "Hit me with all you got"  Whatever I can do with meds, surg and rad's....I will do to lessin that chance of this EVER coming back.  My surgeon never pushed...but after he told me that if i was his wife, that is what he would tell her to do!!!! Now...cosmetically there is an advantage too....I had the DIEP...they take tummy fat and recreat NEW breast.....so the will be the same size and texture....once i'm done with all my chemo and rads....he will lift, size and put the finishing touches on them....42 flat stomanch and great boobs!!!!  Again it is a personal decision, i just wanted to share with you why i did it....I'm soo happy about that decision!!!  Good Luck and let me know if you have any other questions!!! Happy 4th everyone...I'll be sleeping!!!! Polly

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2009 04:33PM candy14510 wrote: Hello Ladies....This NO HAIR thing is mush harder then I thought....I can laugh....but when everyones gone and I look in the mirror....I HATE IT.....and I'm really angry about...I haven't been able to even get back into the swing of work....becasue I don't know what to do....I don't feel comfortable wearing a fake wig...the scarves I can really only tie one way...my baseball cap is really the only thinkg that looks normal on me....but I can't wear that in a professional setting!!! I think post surgery is also not liking all my sitting....my stomach hurts if I sit too long. Last thursday I was working a typical day...in my car for 9-10 hours and i accumilated 16oz of fluid in my lower waist line abouve my insision. HR said I just need to get a note from the doc and I can work 1/2 days or in my car on appts 1/2 day and the other half calling to set appts.  Apart of me just wants to not work and jsut go on long term disability until this is all over.  I sell advertising....the economy sucks on top of it....no one wants to buy and everyone wants to cut back....co-workers not having cancer are feeling beat up.....I don't know if I can take all that rejection with all this going on........sorry....I'll get over it....just upset today.....at least it's a short week...off Thurs and Friday.....a new week next monday!!!!! pdaw and white-Welcome....pdaw, we are on the same chemo plan!!! A/C 3x4 and Taxol 1x12...so far for me things have really been great....3-4 days of being tired, slight headach and food turned my stomach...no vomitting....food didn't look good at all!!!  After that completely normal!! Was working out....running.  Then day 14....HAIR!!!  You start to think your normal and then reality sets in....your bald and everyone knows your sick, including yourself everytime you look in the mirror!!!  Did i say I was having a tough time with the hair?????  Anyway good luck Thursday, I'm sure it will be fine!!! Carolyn, I did searching online about hair coloring.....couldn't find anything about waiting a year!!! I'm going to ask my OC on thursday....My hairdresser said a couple months.....once your regualar hair comes in...not the first hiar....it should be fine.  I will have to check more into it. Diane, glad I could be of help....as you can see today...i'm the one needing some incouragement!!! I am having girls come over wednesday and we are going to play with the scarves and see if there is some style I can be comfortable with. Do you notice you see everyones hair now....I was jealouse of a girl who had cute hair...and thought....what would you look like with out hair???????? Not as pretty im sure!!!!  I will get over it....just not today!!!! Hey do any of you know on the Herceptin.....is that every week????  That's what I saw on line today...I thought it was every 3 weeks???? Patti, sorry about your hair...it happens soooo fast when it starts!!!! I've had as most of the women so far, the short little stubble coming out left and right....I am glad however it's not the long stuff...i'd be crying constantly!!!! As always Ladies....good luck this week and hope all your side effects are minimal!!!!! Polly

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2009 04:42AM candy14510 wrote: Hi Ladies, Just checking in.  Susie, I don't know if you got my chemo treatment, but here it is AC 3x4, Taxtol 1x12. Start was June 12th.  Also I was infused in my wrist above my hand...Laurie, I was dreading the elbow...but she didn't even try to go there....She told me only 30-35% of people get ports and if I could get thru these first 4 AC....I'd be fine...Happy about that, becasue I was so tired after surgery having thinkgs in me!!!  My AC took 15 minutes for the 3 suringes of "THE RED DEVIL" and then 20 min for the other.  They also gave me Steriods thru the IV and someother anti-nausea stuff, prior to chemo...I am getting mine thru the U of Minnesota, private 3-sided room, big windows over looking a pond...TV,DVD and Internet....It was actually enjoyable and a breeze to my surprise. I had minimal side effects...slight headache (took Extra strength Tylenol) did take EMEND...that explained my dizzyness, as its a side effect. was sent home Prochlorperazine and Lorazepam...to take as needed....Lorazepam is also an anti-anxioty med...so they said to take if I had problems sleeping too...Day 2 and 3...TIRED....slight nausea...not throwing up...food just didn't look good...little foggy.  By day 4...Normal!!!  Walked 2 miles...Day 5..walked 2 miles...Yesterday RAN 3....!!!! I felt to Liberated...I cant even tell you!!!  I felt like "Rocky" running up those stairs in the movie....raising his arms over his head.....I DID THAT!!!  To kicking Cancer is the A??!!!! My husband, is like are you sure your allowed to do that??  My doc said so what ever your body allows you to do!!!  I have been Really drinking my WATER!!! I do probley double the 8 glasses aday...i'm doing about 16...FLUSH, FLUSH, FLUSH the system!!!  I couldn't eat well the first few days, so I bought "Ensure" for the protien, but my girlfriend toold me about "Muscle Milk-Lite" 100 calories and 15 grams of Protien!!!  I have also been taking "Centrum-Silver"...yeah I'm 42(next week) and I'm taking "Silver"!!! Just lots of Fruit too!!!  Just HOPING...this will all continue!!!  And my Doctor said, your first cycle, will reflect how your others will go....Only build up is "Fatigue"!!!  I'm going with that!!! Did get my hair cut yesterday...Thought it was going to be more dramatic....but my hair dresser is awesome....she gave me a very cute Pixie Cut....I think it looks a little like "Kate + 8"....SOOO CUTE!!!! anyway, I will only have it for a week or two...but I think it will cut down on the anxioty of 10" hair falling out!!!  And Hey....Maybe I will be that 2%, that doesn't loose your hair???!!! Wishful thinking....but you never know!!!  I have a wig I got for Free, thru a progam at the hospital.  I also bought about 20 scarves....so I'm prepared physically....just not mentally!!! Good Luck Ladies and stay positive.....This will all be over sooner then we ever thought....I know I have 6 months of this...Nov 6th is my last treatment...seems long....but in the end it's only 6 months out of my life to ensure, this NEVER comes back!!!!! It's worth it!!!!  XOXOXO

I've never experienced that, only if I did have swollen feet, my hands were too..."Water retention"....this is different....very strange SE.  Get my Port put in tomorrow am...and 4th Taxol/herceptin...I hate surgery!!! icmag - 3 more weeks of taxol...so you are every 3 weeks?  Sorry I loose track of everyones doeses!!!  I too have had a number of panic attackes....while in the hospital after surgery is when they started...feeling trapped...claustrophbic like....it was strang for me...never having experienced that before.  Also, with some of my treatments....this claustrphobic feeling of this medicine in my body, that is killing cells...and I can't get it out of me.....crazy sh*t!!! Hope it gets better for you!!! I am happy you are getting real hair!!!  I can't wait!!!! I too have had nite flashes...but I always had them occasionaly in the past.....now just more and more often.  Can't sleep well either....I feel like I am just laying there, looking at the clock....I have ambian...but I hate to take it, if I don't HAVE to.... Take Care .... We Can Do It!!!! Polly

Posts.Content: Oct 16, 2009 12:14PM candy14510 wrote: angicpa - I watched "Proof of Living" last night....wow...I agree, I had no idea being DX with HER2+ was such a death threat 10+ years ago....we are very lucky!!!!  And the politics of drug companies, financing....is amazing....I have heard from a few "crazies" that they have a cure for cancer, but would loose so much money putting it out on the other drugs the make lots on....I used to think that was totally crazy....now it makes you thiink!!!! DiDi - I did have my DIEP surgery in May....so I've healed up pretty good....the scaring really fades surprisinly!!!  Still some tummy and breast numb spots...but i do have a lot of feeling.  Very happy with the procedure.  My hair is growing back...still very fuzzy, but much more and dark...eyelashes are growing now too!!!  I have had no bone pain....but some tingling in fingers, hands and feet occasionally.  Now my mouth has been sore...in the back, not the throat....and I can't see any sores....it jsut appears to be sore...hot, cold, carbonated....make it hurt....wierd...I will have to check with my ONC next week....it's gotten worse of the last week.  Water retention...taking something for it...in one week I gain 10 lbs....and i don't feel like im retaining....but the scale didn't go down this week....agian wierd!!!!  All my counts are great...platlets, WB, ....Liver, Kidneys....I do meet with a cardiologist next thursday...I've had some higher BP.  I jsut found out that I will not be getting periodic petscans...becausue my cancer did not spread anywhere else (matastasized) it is too expensive to have regualar MRI's and Petscans.  They will be checking me though blood test and my own symtoms if feel.  Is this the same for you all???  I jsut thought I would get a yearly or 6 months....and if now can i request it???? or Demand it??  I had a petscan before chemo...all clear....but I'd like to know that after I still had nothing....my ONC said...your didn't have cancer before chemo....after chemo you certanily wouldn't have cancer...the chemo will kill any lingering cells that made it out.  Is this your experince as well???? Polly

Posts.Content: Nov 26, 2009 11:45AM candy14510 wrote: Michelle - Yes the tat was the actual nipple color...so when I go for my final recon in Feb...they will make the "nipple" they pucker it up to look like one...My girlfriends looks great...it's amazing what they can do...Then 6 weeks after they will tatoo the areola...so I have a tat that looks like a drawing of a basic truck,turned upside down...wierd...anyway...Oh and my "Flat Spots" from the recon have really gone down...I'm glad I had the surgery first in May...I've had all this 7 months to heal...and since I look like shit...why not do it all at once, right!!! DiDi - Big week this next week for both of us!!!! DONE!!!! So glad!!! I bought the Latisse for eyelashes...I'm going to start after chemo...why waste it, if it's going to fall out??!!! It was on sale from my docs off...normally$120, it was%15 off and a $20 mail in rebate...so $89....I just can't stand these little, thin lashes...I want long, dark, thick lashes!!!!  Eyebrows too!!! Oh, so I get this light blonde thin hair on my sides of my face...baby fine...anyway, that grew back...and when I lost my hair for the 2nd time...I was in a store, looking at a mirror and pulled on it....yep, it came out....I thought i was going to have to wax my lip too....NOPE!!!!LOL Vickie - Glad to hear about your "Thin" ankles!!!! And that you are recovery well from surgery!! So RADS...you will only be getting under your arm right?? your had your breat removed...that is where mine will be...I had my centinal node taken out..it was neg on the cold cut....but after I was outof surgery they have NEW test and found "Micro" cancer cells...so wierd situtation I am in..1/1..don't see that often...so my first onc, said no to rads...not necessary becasue the odds of other nodes having it were slim....my new onc, says yes...it will cut down my reoccurance by 20%...She is with the U of Minnesota...I know if you are having your chest area radiated...it is alot worse...your have all your orgins there...the under arm is much safer..... Joan...Sorry about your SE's.....BUT your DONE!!!! YAY...it's all easy sailing from here!!!!XOXO Icmag - YAY!!!!!! I started to cry when I read you post....that will be me next week..and Michelle!!!! Yeah, what is up with the toenail crap??? I had 2 fall off...they are so brittle..can't wait to start taking my vitamine E...they didn't want me taking it while on chemo...I have lots of herbs and things I can't wait to start taking!!! One is "Suntheanine"...my sister takes it..it's a product of green tea..so natural...and my research actually showed it was good for chemo SE's...but my onc didn't want me taking anything....So I bought those and will start right away after next week!!! glanders- Great 1/2 way with Rads...that is awesome...now SE's...someone on here said they were having a bad reaction...Debi, I think???? so you are radiating your breast....not lympnode area?? Lynn- I like your profile pic...hair is coming in nicely!!! How are your brows and lashes??? So you had final recon....Did you have just a MX...not a Bi-lat?? How long were you out of work??? The PS said a week, when I have mine...I will have some lipo done on them...TOO BIG!!!  Well actually they are the size I was DD....but he said I'd be a C...and I was fine with that...shirts dont botton...in pics all I see are booobs...so I want them smaller...He did a good job...It all came from my tummy...so that's good!!!! Greytmom- I have seen 2 ladies, who have been so kind to show me thier nipples...they both look fabulous!!!! It's a person desicion obviouley....but they were very happy.... Oh speaking of nipples....check this out...on my right side...cancer was on the left....so more scaring and stuff....I COULD FEEL THE TATTOO!!!! on my right side....that was crazy...and doesn't happen very often...but that would tell me my nerves are working in the future nipple area....WOW!!!!! Happy Thanksgiving!!! Polly

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2009 07:13AM - edited Dec 4, 2009 07:16AM by candy14510 UGH!!!! Diane...They should not make you choose!!!!! I left my first ONC, because he left it up to me!!!!  They are the professionals.....They tell YOU....and may say there are options....but they tell you waht they think is the best!!!! DiDi, Diane Icmag-  Congrats to ALL of us.....YES I am DONE!!!!! Interesting with the Rads....Met with my Rad Onc.....Head of the Universtity of Minnesota....I'm looking at your diagnosies....and see some intersting things.....1st...I am IIb, Stg 3, 4.2 cm, ER/PR-, HER2+.....My 1st onc said., NO Rads....When I got my 2nd (from the U of M)...she thought YES, but would talk to others...a couple weeks in she said YES, becasue I am 1/1 for nodes....wierd I know but in surgery they took my Main Node and it was Negative in the OR...later test showed...minsuel cancer....too late to take more, not worth it either, according to docs....however, that left me in a wierd situtation...they didn't know forsure if the other nodes where infected....they ALL guessed and "thought" NO....well that's not good enough for my ONC and Rad Onc....so Diane, I see you have Neg in nodes and 2cm...Im glad they are doing it...and airing on the side of caution is defintaley good and a must for all we have been through!!! DiDi and Icmag,k didn't see your size....but clearly we are all going throught Rads too. I start next Tuesday...my counts have been good...and I have Mexico....so 25 at 200 vs 30 at 180..have a CT also for a small Node in my lung, less then a cm...many have these ...my mom and my sister did/do ahve them, so nothing to worry, just checking it.  I was surprised on the info I got yesterday....I thought because of my Bi-Lat Mx...that I would only have rads in my arm pit area.....WRONG......whole breast, arm pit and upper colar bone area.  3 small tat's only a poke of a needle...tiny freckle. My PS thought, because my ONC told me, no breast would be radiated...Oops...It make sence when she told me WHY, and clearly I  just dont want this to EVER come back....but part of my lungs, close to my heart (but not the nodes by my heart...it's controversial....and Chemo is hard enough on your heart...so just very close)...part of my tyroid....I was told by my Reg Onc I would n't have that and that is good not radiating your chest area...well that is not the case...so I cried a little...but realized I really didn't have a choice.... Intersted in your situations with rads...now that we are past the horriable chemo...I will be driving 50 miles...5 weeks....but I know i'm in good hands....My Rad Onc is meeting with her colleagues this am....to run my situtation past them, to see what they all think too....she called one yeasterday and they agreed with her....Keep in Mind..my first said NO to Rads.....crazy shit!!!! Good luck ladies, getting that last of Chemo crap out...and upward on onward to Rads...hoping they treat us all well!!!!! Polly

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2009 08:22AM candy14510 wrote: Zoohouse10 - My cancer was 4.1 cm...anything over 5cm is radiation.  I don't NEED it...its a "Grey" area.  My doc is from the U of M and the radiologist is from "Harvard".... she just came across a new study,that showed having rads with my situation decreased the chance of return.  I figure if I've done 6 months of Chemo at that point....why not another month of rads, to increase my chance of survial. It is a choice. pdaw - sorry for all the stuff happening this week, it does make it difficult to deal with your own, when so much is happening around you. Hope this week is better for you!!! amig1- sorry to hear about your meltdown....glad you got the courage up to go anyway!!!  I think all of our emotions are "Normal"...just not dwelling on it is "Key" and staying positive!!! Feeling ugly when looking in the mirrow is a very common accurance for me...it's just not the same staring at a bold person in the mirror.  I will soooo appreiciate my hair even more once it comes back!!!  Did I tell the story about my neighbor???  Many men have shaved heads now....I usually say..."Oh, look....I look like you!!!"....well my neighbor shot back...."Polly, your hair will grow back...Mine WONT".  He's right....I can hate it....but it will come back!!!! Met a woman at a local bar....myself just wearing a sweatshirt and baseball cap....she told me her dad had stage 4 lympoma cancer last september.  Doc's said no chance, but we will make you comfortable. It had spread everywhere, but his brain and spinal cord.  He just finished in June and is in full remission!!!  Wouldn't you know he and his wife walked in shortly after...he is 79!!!  Hardley any side effects from chemo....had a full head of hair....looked so happy!!  He told me they "Wrote my off", but here I am!!!!  His daughter told me (which we all know)....being positve helped so much....her sisters where being negative...and she told them to stop it.  He was amazing!!!! Rinna- so sorry about your complications with your surgeries!!!  AND chemo....I'm soooooo Sorry you have to go through that too!!! I cant imagine!!! Hope it gets better for you!!! Keep in mind, the doctor at the end of all this will make your breast perfect!!! You have that right....my doc, when I asked when I could have the "Finishing Touches" done....He goes," Oh, you want that"?....aahhhh, yeah!!!!  He will lift, put a small implant in if I need it once all the swelling is down....and YES they will be the same size and they will be perky!!!  I'm going to have the BEST 42 year old boobs around, damn it!!!! Bettina - Also sorry to hear about your SE with your chemo drug.  Everything I'm on is hard on my heart.  As long as you are healthy....you should be fine!!! Good luck with the new drug!  As I told Rinna, if we have to go through this, I personally am going to have the best boobs around.  For me, being bald and scared....I deserve to feel pretty....everyone is differnet....but getting older, we have seen things go south slowley over the years and if I can get those perky and lookin good....why not...and a flat tummy.....we deserve to have some good, posistive SE too.  It is however a personal decision.....I'm just sharing with you my rationalization of this whole thing!!!! 3rd AC of 4 this Friday....Good Luck to all who have treatments this week...hopw SE are all minimal!!!! My son leaves Tuesday for the Air Force.....I've been crying all morning!!!  I bring him down tomorrow and then we will see him off on Tuesday.....I'm soo happy for him, but am going to miss him soooo much!!! Sept 18th until I see him again.....That will put me OVER half way through this nightmare!!!! How crazy is that, that I'm gagging life by where I am in the treatment of all this!!!????? Polly

Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2009 03:25PM candy14510 wrote: Anna - congrats on being done!!!!!!  So glad your thru all the chemo....I have similar DX as you....I have 8 more Taxol then 5-6 weeks of Rads....complete by end of Jan...continue Herceptin until Sept 2010.....Fun, Fun!!!! Vickie - I personally think that you have a right....there can always be small cells that ended up in a node....I only had my sentinal node removed...it was negative, until they looked at it under the microscope and found micro cells.  they never took addtl ones becasue the initail was negative.  My Surgeon said he spoke with 2 ONC and they agreed I didn't need rads....went to an ONC and he agreed...went to the U of M and she said it is a "grey" area....but she would recommend it....becasue they never took more nodes out...so your really can't be sure.....and said it would drop my reoccurance down by 20%!!!!!  Second opinion FOR SURE!!!!! icmag -  Awesome!!!! Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2009 03:40PM - edited Nov 13, 2009 03:41PM by candy14510 Pam - I had the DIEP.....love it!!! Has your doctor done a lot of them...mine had done about 95 @ the time...he did an awesome job...my breast scares are very light...my flat nipple area has smoothed out...My surgery was in May...I love not having my GUT!!!!  I still have numbness in my stomach and partial breast area..but they were amazed as to how much I could feel 2 months after....so I think it will all be good!! My girlfriend the the tram....she is still numb around the scare, but she says, you never get the full feeling around your waist from your pants...cuz you really cant feel it....i'v noticed that...it is a blessing when you are sitting in a car for along time!!!  I had heard one women  who I talked to said she was kick-boxing 4 weeks after...I will tell you that was not my case...I had a goal to go back to work in 4 weeks....didn't happen for me...It was 7 weeks...I drive alot...so I waited...ended up only going for a week and a half...not becasue of my surgery...just the whole chemo thing...so it really depends on your job discription!!!  I was also a DD before and he made me one again...so my suregrey was 12 hours about....The women that was kick boxing...was very small...so I guess the surgrey wasn't at BIG as mine.  I'm very pleased with it...I am getting my nipple tat in 2 weeks and then after chemo will get the final stages of my NEW breasts.....I am having him lipo them to a full C....bottoning shirts have been a bitch most of my life...so I want smaller.  I will tell you they now move like boobs and are firmer...It's amazing what they can do!!!!  I think the first week is the hardest....My sisters flew in to help...I has surgery on a tueday and went home on a saturday...I had blood pressure issues and some horriable gas pains they couldn't do anything about, due to the long surgery...That was hard for 36 hours and then it passed...I started walking short distances .... and jsut did as much as I felt comfortable with.  Slepping...LOT of PILLOWS!!!!!! under your legs and behind your head...learn to NOT use your stomach muscles when trying to sit up...hard to do!!!!  If you have any questions at all....let me know!!!! HUGS, Polly

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2009 08:55PM candy14510 wrote: Carolyn - I wont be done until Christmas as well....we just did things in different orders!!!  I had my DIEP May 5th.....then started Chemo on June 12th. I met with my PS on Monday....Feel really good about the revisions that will happen.  I am doing the nipple recon....while on chemo I can have the first stage....Tatooing.....I always said I wanted a Tatoo when I turned 40....not really me...but now I am!!!!  i will wait until after chemo and Rads in January....then will...as my husband says....put the "finishing touches" on!!!!! Any questions you have, please ask!!!! I felt better knowing....having both removed, would put me at peace....my grandmother died of BC....but she could have survived.....she got it in one....10 yrs later in the other....She hated the chemo so much she refused it.....Personally going thru this....there have been times when I GET her ratioanlization of it.......I DONT want to go thru this agian.  However Carolyn it is toataly a personal decision!!! Good Luck...and please ask!!!! Read below as well...... PDAW- Read above as well.....so I dont' repeat myself and bore you. Here is how this all happened....My Doc/Surgeon....said here are your choices...you see my DX...I imediatley said BI-Lat.....He never incourgaged me....once I told him....he said..."If you were my wife Polly....I would have her do the same thing"......My best friend was DX 6 yrs ago.....never had to do chemo....but had a MX...single....she had the TRAM....it takes the muscle and puts it up in the breast area....complications down the road can be "Hernias"...simailar, but blugging  out in the stomach area.  She is completley happy....but ended up with an implant on the otherside, becasue they did not match.  The DIEP does not take muscle.....ONLY FAT!!!! Less downtime....it's amazing how they look...everyone looks at my breast, when I say I have BC....anyway,  had an excellent PC...ALL the docs comment about how great it looks....I have feeling that my girlfreind doesnt have....it was the best dscn I ever made.....and I can not wait until they "fine tune" the rest when I am done!!!!!  Please ask any questions.....I will even show you pics if you want....privately of course....Sorry to the Rads....My PS did have concern about having my procedure then possiabley having rads later....I cried and said this is what I wanted....he did it...and now he's so happy with his results...it's not a big deal that I will have rad later....potentaily it could harm the breast tissue....but the removed my breast...they are only doing rads on my arm pit...not my breast!!! And I go to the University of Minnesota....she said my Rads...are not a black and white issue...its a GREY area.....Studies showed that reaccurance is less in my case to have the rads....at this point.....why wouldn't I.....I have gone this far....And ALL my docs, becasue of the stageIII and aggressiveness....ALL thought that I didn't HAVE to do it forsure.....but would probley do it anyway as a precaution.  This is only MY situation....I just don't want to go thru this shit again!!!!! Polly

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2010 07:41PM candy14510 wrote: FYI about Cancer Survivors..... The National Coalition for Cancer Survivorship (NCCS) pioneered the definition of survivor as from the time of diagnosis and for the balance of life, a person diagnosed with cancer is a survivor. This expansive definition of "survivor" includes people who are dying from untreatable cancer. NCCS later expanded the definition of survivor even further to include family, friends and caregivers who are affected by the diagnosis in any way. XXOO - Polly
